Posts.Title: Generics in Java vs .NET
Posts.Subtitle: A .NET developer's perspective
Posts.Excerpt:
Background

I'm a .NET developer, writing C# code. But 9 months ago, I joined company whose tech stack is almost exclusively Java. As I have gotten more into writing Java code, I have become more aware of the differences between Java and my beloved C#.

Both Java and C# are at their core object-oriented general-purpose programming languages, with similar syntaxes, but there are some fundamental differences that ar not apparent until you dig deeper. In particular, when coming to...
